content.title: About us
description: We are a cybersecurity and technological development company, with great experience in the national and international market, whose base responds to the great team that composes it.
We are permanently seeking to develop and enhance innovative services that impact many businesses.
We strive to continually grow in knowledge and technical skills, and we work to create an environment where respect and friendship among all.
We put in front of each client all our experience, dedication and ideas to make each service an instance of great satisfaction for those who benefit from our work.

content.title: Alliance with Baker Tilly
description: We work side by side in partnership with Baker Tilly, a global professional services firm in auditing, tax advisory, consulting and outsourcing, from where we have been able to enhance our services, developing a deeper understanding of the risks faced by various industries and companies.

content.title: Projects financed by Corfo
description: Our projects have been awarded innovation funds in Corfo, including a seed capital fund, which aims to promote innovation in products and services and the Crea y Valida fund, which supports the development of technological services, from the prototype to its technical validation at industrial and commercial level, incorporating stages of Research and Development (R+D+I).

content.title: Chrisalys Incubator
description: We participated in the Chrisalys incubation program for a whole year, receiving a great development experience.

form.title: get in touch
form.subtitle: we are here to help you

audit.title: Audit
description: The objective of our audit is to be able to perform a thorough examination of the infrastructure, systems and processes related to the IT area of a company, in order to identify information security gaps and mitigate the risks of cyber-attacks.
Our work process usually consists of 5 major topics, however, it all depends on the scope of work, according to the needs of the company.

risksAndVulnerabilities.title: Risks & vulnerabilities detection
risksAndVulnerabilities.description: Initial phase of the security audit where the reconnaissance, test plan, penetration tests and collection of evidence of vulnerabilities in the systems and networks to be audited are performed.

infrastructure.title: Infrastucture analysis
infrastructure.description: A comprehensive assessment of the company's IT infrastructure is performed, where the integration characteristics, i.e. configurations, versions or programmatic processes in the ecosystem are analyzed.

procedures.title: Procedures analysis
procedures.description: Faculty of the audit where a survey of tasks, directives, practices, policies or related documentation related to the handling or interaction with information assets is made. Through this analysis, vulnerabilities can be identified that lead to changes in organizational and cultural terms to improve the way information is handled.

mitigation.title: Mitigation
mitigation.description: Phase of the audit where risk mitigation recommendations are developed, as well as possible implementation of improvements and corrections. The audit results serve as the basis for developing an action plan to help implement improvements, corrections and IT security best practices.

socialEngineering.title: Social engineering
socialEngineering.description: Discipline of auditing where human practices or behaviors of the members of the organization are evaluated and tested for violations, in order to obtain relevant and confidential information from a company, accessing systems, information networks, among others.

isoIec27000.title: ISO/IEC 27000
description: Cyber-attacks have become a norm these days, every day more and more organizations suffer security breaches that are exploited by increasingly sophisticated cyber-attacks. Moreover, these phenomena are increasing as the process of digitalization of companies advances.

When we talk about information security, it is usually related to information systems and information storage on digital media. However, security breaches encompass much more than these elements, including aspects related to the handling of information throughout the organization, its collection, storage, distribution, among other sources of IT risks.

In response to the above, the ISO 27000 standards are a framework of good practices related to the implementation, maintenance and management of the Information Security Management System (ISMS). This system is aimed at developing a culture of continuous improvement and IT risk mitigation in organizations, regardless of company size or type of industry
As consultants in this area, we seek to collaborate in explaining the benefits of adopting a system of this magnitude and to accompany them in the implementation process.

chl21459.title: Chilean Law NÂ° 21459
description: Law 21.459, enacted on June 9, 2022, establishes rules regarding computer crimes, which include:
- Integrity of a computer system (article 1)
- Unlawful access (article 2)
- Unlawful Interception (article 3)
- Attack on the integrity of computer data (article 4)
- Computer forgery (article 5)
- Reception of computer data (article 6)
- Computer fraud (article 7)
- Abuse of devices (article 8)

For these purposes, penalties are established, which, according to their seriousness, range from minor imprisonment in its minimum degree to major imprisonment in its minimum degree, in addition to fines ranging from 11 to 40 monthly tax units. All these offenses are applicable to legal entities

In view of the exposure that companies have to be victims of these cyber crimes, it is recommended to take different precautions for the protection of information. This is even more sensitive if we consider the safeguarding of confidential information or information that by law, or contract, must be kept in reserve.

Given the above, as a company we have developed a model of computer crime prevention, whose implementation and certification is partly mandatory for legal entities, but at the same time is a fundamental element that aims to exempt companies from any liability for computer crimes, such as those mentioned above.
Faced with this scenario as a company we want to provide all the necessary support to accompany you in the process of implementing a model of computer crime prevention, do not hesitate to contact us!
